title: rustc panics if a `dyn` is added/removed with `node_id_to_type: no type for node`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
A minimal reproducer is in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/tanriol/0d19db457b7c0c397da6229db828efdd).

Can be reproduced by unzipping the files and running
```sh
cargo clean && cargo check --lib && git apply add-dyn.patch && cargo check --lib ; git apply -R add-dyn.patch
```

The crates checks successfully, but adding a `dyn` to have `pub instrument: Box<dyn Write>,` and rechecking results in the following ICE

```
error: internal compiler error: librustc/ty/context.rs:530: node_id_to_type: no type for node `type Write (id=353)`

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors/lib.rs:554:9
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
             at libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/tracing/gcc_s.rs:49
   1: std::sys_common::backtrace::print
             at libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:71
             at libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59
   2: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}
             at libstd/panicking.rs:211
   3: std::panicking::default_hook
             at libstd/panicking.rs:227
   4: rustc::util::common::panic_hook
   5: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
             at libstd/panicking.rs:467
   6: std::panicking::begin_panic
   7: rustc_errors::Handler::bug
   8: rustc::session::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}}
   9: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}}
  10: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_context_opt
  11: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_opt
  12: rustc::session::opt_span_bug_fmt
  13: rustc::session::bug_fmt
  14: rustc::ty::context::TypeckTables::node_id_to_type
  15: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_path_parameters
  16: rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor::visit_path
  17: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_qpath
  18: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_path_parameters
  19: rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor::visit_path
  20: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_qpath
  21: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_expr
  22: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_expr
  23: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_nested_body
  24: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_item
  25: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_item
  26: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_expr
  27: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_expr
  28: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_nested_body
  29: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_item
  30: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_item
  31: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_expr
  32: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_expr
  33: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_nested_body
  34: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_item
  35: rustc::hir::intravisit::walk_item
  36: <rustc_privacy::TypePrivacyVisitor<'a, 'tcx> as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor<'tcx>>::visit_item
  37: rustc_privacy::privacy_access_levels
  38: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_context                   
  39: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
  40: rustc::ty::context::tls::with_related_context                                                                
  41: rustc::ty::maps::plumbing::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt<'a, 'gcx, 'tcx>>::force_query_with_job
  42: rustc::ty::maps::plumbing::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt<'a, 'gcx, 'tcx>>::get_query
  43: rustc::util::common::time
  44: rustc::ty::context::tls::enter_context                   
  45: <std::thread::local::LocalKey<T>>::with                
  46: rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt::create_and_enter
  47: rustc_driver::driver::compile_input        
  48: rustc_driver::run_compiler_impl            
  49: <scoped_tls::ScopedKey<T>>::set          
  50: syntax::with_globals             
  51: <std::panic::AssertUnwindSafe<F> as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once
  52: __rust_maybe_catch_panic         
             at libpanic_unwind/lib.rs:105
  53: rustc_driver::run                   
  54: rustc_driver::main               
  55: std::rt::lang_start::{{closure}}
  56: std::panicking::try::do_call
             at libstd/rt.rs:59                    
             at libstd/panicking.rs:310             
  57: __rust_maybe_catch_panic                 
             at libpanic_unwind/lib.rs:105
  58: std::rt::lang_start_internal    
             at libstd/panicking.rs:289
             at libstd/panic.rs:374                    
             at libstd/rt.rs:58                   
  59: main                                       
  60: __libc_start_main                                                                                  
  61: <unknown>                                   
query stack during panic:                        
#0 [privacy_access_levels] privacy access levels                                                         
end of query stack                     
error: aborting due to previous error
```

After `cargo clean` it checks with `dyn`, while removing it causes another ICE.

Happens both for `rustc 1.27.0 (3eda71b00 2018-06-19)` and for `rustc 1.28.0-nightly (f28c7aef7 2018-06-19)`. Linux x86_64 (`x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu`), `compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib`.
